Title: She Fell in Love With ChatGPT. Like, Actual Love. With Sex.
Author: By Natalie Kitroeff, Kashmir Hill, Nina Feldman, Sydney Harper, Shannon M. Lin, Mary Wilson, Brendan Klinkenberg, Michael Benoist, Diane Wong, Marion Lozano, Rowan Niemisto, Elisheba Ittoop, Pat McCusker and Chris Wood
Summary: The story of a woman who is dating an A.I. chatbot, and what it tells us about love and technology.
Full Article Content: Warning: This episode discusses sexual themes.

Title: ChatGPT Is Restored After Hourslong Outage
Author: By Victor Mather
Summary: Thousands of users were unable to access OpenAI’s chatbot starting around 6 a.m. on Thursday. Shortly after 10 a.m., the company said the issue had been resolved.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT was disrupted for several hours on Thursday morning, with thousands of users reporting difficulty accessing the chatbot before service was restored.

Title: She Is in Love With ChatGPT
Author: By Kashmir Hill
Summary: A 28-year-old woman with a busy social life spends hours on end talking to her A.I. boyfriend for advice and consolation. And yes, they do have sex.
Full Article Content: Ayrin’s love affair with her A.I. boyfriend started last summer.

Title: How Helpful Is Operator, OpenAI’s New A.I. Agent?
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: Operator, a new computer-using tool from OpenAI, is brittle and occasionally erratic, but it points to a future of powerful A.I. agents.
Full Article Content: In the past week, OpenAI’s Operator has done the following things for me:

Title: They Invested Billions. Then the A.I. Script Got Flipped.
Author: By Erin Griffith
Summary: Venture capitalists plowed money into A.I. start-ups like OpenAI and Anthropic. But the rise of the Chinese A.I. start-up DeepSeek has called that funding frenzy into question.
Full Article Content: Jordan Jacobs, an investor at the venture capital firm Radical Ventures, has spent the last few days fielding half a dozen calls from his firm’s investors. All of them wanted to know about DeepSeek, a Chinese artificial intelligence app that topped the app stores over the weekend.

Title: First Impressions of DeepSeek’s A.I. Chatbot
Author: By Eli Tan
Summary: The chatbot from China appears to perform a number of tasks as well as its American competitors do, but it censors topics such as Tiananmen Square.
Full Article Content: A new chatbot created by the Chinese company DeepSeek is the talk of the A.I. world, and has sent a jolt through the U.S. stock market. Not only does it seem to be comparable to those of leading companies like OpenAI and Anthropic, but it was seemingly created with a fraction of the resources.

Title: OpenAI Unveils A.I. Agent That Can Use Websites on Its Own
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The new tool, called Operator, can shop for groceries or book a restaurant reservation. But it still needs help from humans.
Full Article Content: Two years ago, OpenAI launched the chatbot craze with the release of ChatGPT. Now it hopes to spark interest in a new wave of A.I. technology.

Title: OpenAI Courts Trump With Vision for ‘A.I. in America’
Author: By Cade Metz and Cecilia Kang
Summary: The maker of ChatGPT hopes to spur investment from the Middle East and avoid strict regulations on the development of new technologies.
Full Article Content: In December, Sam Altman, OpenAI’s chief executive, donated $1 million to President-elect Donald J. Trump’s inaugural fund, joining a number of other tech executives who are working to improve their relationships with Mr. Trump.

Title: At the Intersection of A.I. and Spirituality
Author: By Eli Tan
Summary: Modern religious leaders are experimenting with A.I. just as earlier generations examined radio, television and the internet.
Full Article Content: To members of his synagogue, the voice that played over the speakers of Congregation Emanu El in Houston sounded just like Rabbi Josh Fixler’s.

Title: The 2024 Good Tech Awards
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: In a year of continued A.I. progress, “founder mode” drama and a Trump election win, a few tech projects stood out for their clear benefits to humanity.
Full Article Content: In the tech industry, 2024 was a year of fast change and shifting winds.

Title: OpenAI Unveils New A.I. That Can ‘Reason’ Through Math and Science Problems
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The artificial intelligence start-up said the new system, OpenAI o3, outperformed leading A.I. technologies on tests that rate skills in math, science, coding and logic.
Full Article Content: OpenAI on Friday unveiled a new artificial intelligence system, OpenAI o3, which is designed to “reason” through problems involving math, science and computer programming.

Title: Why Wouldn’t ChatGPT Say This Dead Professor’s Name?
Author: By Ali Watkins
Summary: A bizarre saga in which users noticed the chatbot refused to say “David Mayer” raised questions about privacy and A.I., with few clear answers.
Full Article Content: Across the final years of his life, David Mayer, a theater professor living in Manchester, England, faced the cascading consequences of an unfortunate coincidence: A dead Chechen rebel on a terror watch list had once used Mr. Mayer’s name as an alias.

Title: Why Does OpenAI Need So Much Money?
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: Building a chatbot like ChatGPT requires billions upon billions of dollars. That’s the driving force behind OpenAI’s plans to change how it’s managed.
Full Article Content: Early last year, OpenAI raised $10 billion. Just 18 months later, the company had burned through most of that money. So it raised $6.6 billion more and arranged to borrow an additional $4 billion.

Title: How OpenAI Hopes to Sever Its Nonprofit Roots
Author: By David A. Fahrenthold, Cade Metz and Mike Isaac
Summary: As the maker of ChatGPT battles Google and Meta for A.I. supremacy, it’s also fighting to end control by a nonprofit board.
Full Article Content: Last fall, the nonprofit that controls OpenAI tried to fire the company’s high-profile leader, Sam Altman. It failed.

Title: Sam Altman on Microsoft, Trump and Musk
Author: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Sarah Kessler
Summary: The OpenAI C.E.O. spoke with Andrew Ross Sorkin at the DealBook Summit.
Full Article Content: Since kicking off the artificial intelligence boom with the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, OpenAI has amassed more than 300 million weekly users and a $157 billion valuation. Its C.E.O., Sam Altman, addressed whether that staggering pace of growth can continue at the DealBook Summit last week.

Title: Major Canadian News Outlets Sue OpenAI in New Copyright Case
Author: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff
Summary: A coalition of some of Canada’s biggest media companies is seeking billions of dollars in compensation for what they say is copyright infringement on their work through ChatGPT.
Full Article Content: A coalition of Canada’s biggest news organizations is suing OpenAI, the maker of the artificial intelligence chatbot, ChatGPT, accusing the company of illegally using their content in the first case of its kind in the country.

Title: Crypto Congress + HBD ChatGPT + What Social Media Platform Should I Be On?
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Whitney Jones, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Rowan Niemisto and Diane Wong
Summary: Cryptocurrency is poised to have a huge year in 2025.
Full Article Content: This week, we explore how the 2024 election paved the way for a new crypto-friendly Congress and what that means for the future of crypto. Then, for ChatGPT’s second birthday, Nick Turley, ChatGPT head of product at OpenAI, stops by to tell us where it goes from here and share some of his favorite chatbot hacks. Finally, a listener emailed us last week asking what social network he should be using in 2024. We’ll share our thoughts on which text-based platforms are the least annoying.

Title: A.I. Chatbots Defeated Doctors at Diagnosing Illness
Author: By Gina Kolata
Summary: A small study found ChatGPT outdid human physicians when assessing medical case histories, even when those doctors were using a chatbot.
Full Article Content: Dr. Adam Rodman, an expert in internal medicine at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Boston, confidently expected that chatbots built to use artificial intelligence would help doctors diagnose illnesses.

Title: OpenAI Folds A.I.-Powered Search Engine Into ChatGPT
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The popular online chatbot can now access and deliver information from across the internet in real time, including news, stock prices and sports scores.
Full Article Content: OpenAI has folded a search engine into its ChatGPT chatbot.

Title: Stand-Up, Drama and Spambots: The Creative World Takes On A.I.
Author: By Erin Griffith
Summary: Artificial intelligence has become a subject for people in the art and theater worlds who are worried about being replaced by it.
Full Article Content: Inside a curved glass building next to the Golden State Warriors’ arena in San Francisco, eight cans of Spam with tiny arms whirred to life, tapping out artificial-intelligence-generated word slop on miniature keyboards. They were part of the Misalignment A.I. Museum, a gallery dedicated to A.I.-inspired art.

Title: I Took a ‘Decision Holiday’ and Put A.I. in Charge of My Life
Author: By Kashmir Hill and Hang Do Thi Duc
Summary: I thought it would make me put glue on pizza, but instead it entertained my children and got me to finally paint my office. How could it transform our daily lives?
Full Article Content: I thought it would make me put glue on pizza, but instead it entertained my children and got me to finally paint my office. How could it transform our daily lives?

Title: Elon Musk’s xAI in Funding Talks That Could Value Company at $40 Billion
Author: By Mike Isaac and Cade Metz
Summary: The financing efforts follow that of rival OpenAI, which recently closed a funding round that valued it at $157 billion.
Full Article Content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence start-up, xAI, is in talks to raise new financing that could value it at as much as $40 billion, up from $24 billion five months ago, three people with knowledge of the discussions said.

Title: Who Is That You Are Chatting With? Oh, Just ChatGPT.
Author: By Jessica Roy
Summary: The artificial intelligence chatbot’s Advanced Voice Mode feature has delighted some users and weirded out others.
Full Article Content: When you think of what a voice programmed by artificial intelligence would sound like, you might picture something robotic and stilted, with a staccato cadence incapable of capturing the inflections, speed and emotion required to sound even somewhat human. But this is 2024, and the robots have gotten a serious upgrade. Now they can imitate voices, accents and intonation to an almost creepy degree — for better or worse.

Title: Former OpenAI Researcher Says the Company Broke Copyright Law
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: Suchir Balaji helped gather and organize the enormous amounts of internet data used to train the startup’s ChatGPT chatbot.
Full Article Content: Suchir Balaji spent nearly four years as an artificial intelligence researcher at OpenAI. Among other projects, he helped gather and organize the enormous amounts of internet data the company used to build its online chatbot, ChatGPT.

Title: Microsoft and OpenAI’s Close Partnership Shows Signs of Fraying
Author: By Cade Metz, Mike Isaac and Erin Griffith
Summary: The “best bromance in tech” has had a reality check as OpenAI has tried to change its deal with Microsoft and the software maker has tried to hedge its bet on the start-up.
Full Article Content: Last fall, Sam Altman, OpenAI’s chief executive, asked his counterpart at Microsoft, Satya Nadella, if the tech giant would invest billions of dollars in the start-up.

Title: OpenAI Unveils New ChatGPT That Can Reason Through Math and Science
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: Driven by new technology called OpenAI o1, the chatbot can test various strategies and try to identify mistakes as it tackles complex tasks.
Full Article Content: Online chatbots like ChatGPT from OpenAI and Gemini from Google sometimes struggle with simple math problems. The computer code they generate is often buggy and incomplete. From time to time, they even make stuff up.

Title: OpenAI Adds $4 Billion Credit Line on Top of $6.6 Billion Investment Round
Author: By Michael J. de la Merced and Mike Isaac
Summary: The San Francisco company is gathering the billions its executives believe they will need to continue building new A.I. technology.
Full Article Content: OpenAI has set up a $4 billion credit line from an array of banks, adding to its financial firepower after securing a $6.6 billion round of new investments, the company said on Thursday.

Title: The Challenge Is to Write 50,000 Words in a Month. Should ChatGPT Be Able to Help?
Author: By Madison Malone Kircher
Summary: An online writing community was set aflame this week after National Novel Writing Month, or NaNoWriMo, said it wouldn’t take a stance on the use of A.I.
Full Article Content: For over 20 years, writers around the world have participated in National Novel Writing Month, or #NaNoWriMo, as it’s known online. The challenge is simple: Write 50,000 words in the month of November. Well, as simple as writing 50,000 words can be. (That’s 1,667 words per day, for those of you doing the math at home.)

Title: Can You Tell Which Short Story ChatGPT Wrote?
Author: By Curtis Sittenfeld, Susannah Meadows and Phoebe Lett
Summary: What the fiction author Curtis Sittenfeld learned in a writing competition race against the machine.
Full Article Content: In this era of artificial intelligence, who can compose a better beach read for the vacationing masses? The beloved fiction writer Curtis Sittenfeld … or ChatGPT?

Title: OpenAI Is Growing Fast and Burning Through Piles of Money
Author: By Mike Isaac and Erin Griffith
Summary: As the company looks for more outside investors, documents reviewed by The New York Times show consumer fascination with ChatGPT and a serious need for more cash.
Full Article Content: OpenAI, the San Francisco start-up behind ChatGPT, has been telling investors that it is making billions from its chatbot and that it expects to make a lot more in the coming years. But it has not been quite so clear about how much it is losing.

Title: Why Is OpenAI Trying to Raise So Much Money?
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The San Francisco A.I. start-up believes there is not enough computing power on Earth to build the artificial intelligence it wants to create.
Full Article Content: Earlier this year, word spread that Sam Altman, OpenAI’s chief executive, was pitching a plan that he hoped would pump trillions of dollars into the construction of new silicon chip factories and computer data centers.

Title: What Happened to the A.I. Election? + ChatGPT for Mayor + The Productivity Tools We’re Using
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Rachel Cohn, Whitney Jones, Jen Poyant, Daniel Ramirez, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano, Pat McCusker and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: “It’s happening, but people don’t want it public.”
Full Article Content: This week, we discuss why so few campaigns seem to be experimenting with A.I. The Times’s Sheera Frenkel joins us with examples of the many different artificial intelligence products that have been turned down by campaigns in this election cycle, from A.I.-generated endorsements from long-dead historical figures to a synthetic version of Donald Trump. Then, we interview the Wyoming man who ran for mayor on the promise that he would exclusively use a customized ChatGPT bot to run the city. And finally, it’s time for a tech check. We run down the apps we’re using to become more productive.

Title: The Brilliance and Weirdness of ChatGPT
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: A new chatbot from OpenAI is inspiring awe, fear, stunts and attempts to circumvent its guardrails.
Full Article Content: Like most nerds who read science fiction, I’ve spent a lot of time wondering how society will greet true artificial intelligence, if and when it arrives. Will we panic? Start sucking up to our new robot overlords? Ignore it and go about our daily lives?

Title: That Message From Your Doctor? It May Have Been Drafted by A.I.
Author: By Teddy Rosenbluth
Summary: Overwhelmed by queries, physicians are turning to artificial intelligence to correspond with patients. Many have no clue that the replies are software-generated.
Full Article Content: Every day, patients send hundreds of thousands of messages to their doctors through MyChart, a communications platform that is nearly ubiquitous in U.S. hospitals.

Title: Is Math the Path to Chatbots That Don’t Make Stuff Up?
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: Chatbots like ChatGPT get stuff wrong. But researchers are building new A.I. systems that can verify their own math — and maybe more.
Full Article Content: On a recent afternoon, Tudor Achim gave a brain teaser to an A.I. bot called Aristotle.

Title: How Does ChatGPT Really Work?
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: Learning how a “large language model” operates.
Full Article Content: In the second of our five-part series, I’m going to explain how the technology actually works.

Title: Can ChatGPT Make This Podcast?
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Paula Szuchman, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Rowan Niemisto and Alyssa Moxley
Summary: OpenAI’s new chatbot is a coder, a teacher, a potential Google killer, and … a friend?
Full Article Content: It’s writing podcast scripts, finishing students’ homework and correcting mistakes in computer code: ChatGPT, the A.I. chatbot from OpenAI, is suddenly everywhere. Who should decide how it’s built? What could go wrong? And what could go right?

Title: The ChatGPT Lawyer Explains Himself
Author: By Benjamin Weiser and Nate Schweber
Summary: In a cringe-inducing court hearing, a lawyer who relied on A.I. to craft a motion full of made-up case law said he “did not comprehend” that the chat bot could lead him astray.
Full Article Content: As the court hearing in Manhattan began, the lawyer, Steven A. Schwartz, appeared nervously upbeat, grinning while talking with his legal team. Nearly two hours later, Mr. Schwartz sat slumped, his shoulders drooping and his head rising barely above the back of his chair.

Title: Picture Prompt: A ChatGPT Valentine
Author: By The Learning Network
Summary: Play with The Times’s A. I. valentine generator and see what you think of the results.
Full Article Content: Note to teachers: Please preview this tool to make sure it is appropriate for your students.

Title: How ChatGPT Hijacks Democracy
Author: By Nathan E. Sanders and Bruce Schneier
Summary: The greatest threat A.I. may present is its ability to replace humans in lobbying.
Full Article Content: Launched just weeks ago, ChatGPT is already threatening to upend how we draft everyday communications like emails, college essays and myriad other forms of writing.

Title: ‘Artificial Flavors’ Review: Blame ChatGPT for This Musical
Author: By Naveen Kumar
Summary: Each performance culminates in a production, composed on the spot, with misguided help from artificial intelligence.
Full Article Content: Artificial intelligence can paint meddlesome monkeys, speak in the basso profundo of James Earl Jones and play a tune to suit a hall of mirrors. But it can’t write a musical that doesn’t feel canned (at least, not yet). That’s the argument put forward by “Artificial Flavors,” a live demonstration of A.I.’s creative capabilities — and tedious limitations — at 59E59 Theaters.

Title: Despite Cheating Fears, Schools Repeal ChatGPT Bans
Author: By Natasha Singer
Summary: Some districts that once raced to block A.I. chatbots are now trying to embrace them.
Full Article Content: For decades, Walla Walla High School in the wheat basket of Washington State has maintained an old red wooden barn on campus where students learn a venerable farming skill: how to raise pigs and sheep.

Title: What Would Plato Say About ChatGPT?
Author: By Zeynep Tufekci
Summary: A.I. can be a learning tool for schools with enough teachers and resources to use it well.
Full Article Content: Plato mourned the invention of the alphabet, worried that the use of text would threaten traditional memory-based arts of rhetoric. In his “Dialogues,” arguing through the voice of Thamus, the Egyptian king of the gods, Plato claimed the use of this more modern technology would create “forgetfulness in the learners’ souls, because they will not use their memories,” that it would impart “not truth but only the semblance of truth” and that those who adopt it would “appear to be omniscient and will generally know nothing,” with “the show of wisdom without the reality.”

Title: The New ChatGPT Can ‘See’ and ‘Talk.’ Here’s What It’s Like.
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: The image-recognition feature could have many uses, and the voice feature is even more intriguing.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT — viral artificial intelligence sensation, slayer of boring office work, sworn enemy of high school teachers and Hollywood screenwriters alike — is getting some new powers.

Title: ChatGPT Is Banned in Italy Over Privacy Concerns
Author: By Adam Satariano
Summary: The action by Italy’s data protection agency is the first known instance of the chatbot’s being blocked by a government order.
Full Article Content: The artificial intelligence tool ChatGPT was temporarily banned in Italy on Friday, the first known instance of the chatbot being blocked by a government order.

Title: Will ChatGPT Make Me Irrelevant?
Author: By Frank Bruni
Summary: Artificial intelligence works magic but at a price: our pride of ownership and sense of purpose.
Full Article Content: Like every other journalist I know, I often and unabashedly ask for help. Friends give me ideas. Colleagues give me phrases. Editors suggest what to keep, what to cut and where a key detail belongs. My field of vision is only so wide, my brain only so big. I’d be a fool not to supplement.

Title: Noam Chomsky: The False Promise of ChatGPT
Author: By Noam Chomsky, Ian Roberts and Jeffrey Watumull
Summary: The most prominent strain of A.I. encodes a flawed conception of language and knowledge.
Full Article Content: Jorge Luis Borges once wrote that to live in a time of great peril and promise is to experience both tragedy and comedy, with “the imminence of a revelation” in understanding ourselves and the world. Today our supposedly revolutionary advancements in artificial intelligence are indeed cause for both concern and optimism. Optimism because intelligence is the means by which we solve problems. Concern because we fear that the most popular and fashionable strain of A.I. — machine learning — will degrade our science and debase our ethics by incorporating into our technology a fundamentally flawed conception of language and knowledge.

Title: China Chases ChatGPT’s Success
Author: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Summary: A wave of Chinese tech companies are announcing their own A.I.-powered chatbots — but face hurdles imposed by their own government.
Full Article Content: The hottest story in technology right now is the rise of ChatGPT, and the race among tech giants like Microsoft and Google to offer A.I.-powered services of their own. But the A.I. arms race isn’t confined to the U.S.; other countries are also rushing to show they’re big players.

Title: ChatGPT Gets Fresh Competition
Author: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Summary: Google and Baidu are set to introduce their own A.I.-powered chatbots to challenge OpenAI, Microsoft and the rising popularity of ChatGPT.
Full Article Content: Just over two months ago, OpenAI released ChatGPT to the public, instantly thrusting the A.I.-powered chatbot into the center of mainstream discourse, with debates about how it could transform business, education and more. (It also spurred Microsoft to invest $10 billion in OpenAI.)

Title: ChatGPT Has a Devastating Sense of Humor
Author: By Farhad Manjoo
Summary: The chat bot makes a lot of mistakes. But it’s fun to talk to, and it knows its limitations.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT makes an irresistible first impression. It’s got a devastating sense of humor, a stunning capacity for dead-on mimicry, and it can rhyme like nobody’s business. Then there is its overwhelming reasonableness. When ChatGPT fails the Turing test, it’s usually because it refuses to offer its own opinion on just about anything. When was the last time real people on the internet declined to tell you what they really think?

Title: OpenAI to Offer New Version of ChatGPT for a $20 Monthly Fee
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The San Francisco artificial intelligence lab has seen overwhelming interest in its chatbot since it was released in November.
Full Article Content: In November, OpenAI wowed the world when it released an experimental online chatbot called ChatGPT that could answer questions, write poetry and riff on almost any topic tossed its way.

Title: OpenAI Lets Mom-and-Pop Shops Customize ChatGPT
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: With a new GPTs service, anyone can build a chatbot and instantly share it with friends, family and the general public.
Full Article Content: OpenAI said on Monday that it had created a service that allows individuals and small businesses to build customized versions of its popular online chatbot, ChatGPT, and instantly share them on the internet.

Title: A.I. Needs an International Watchdog, ChatGPT Creators Say
Author: By Gregory Schmidt
Summary: To manage its risks, “superintelligent” artificial intelligence should be governed by a body similar to the International Atomic Energy Agency, the lab’s leadership said in note on its website.
Full Article Content: The leaders of OpenAI, the artificial intelligence research lab that developed the chatbot ChatGPT, have called for regulation of “superintelligent” A.I. technology, saying it “will be more powerful than other technologies humanity has had to contend with in the past.”

Title: What Students Are Saying About ChatGPT
Author: By The Learning Network
Summary: Is this new chatbot the end of education as we know it? Or a useful new tool for learning? Teenagers weigh in.
Full Article Content: By now you’ve probably heard of ChatGPT, a powerful new artificial intelligence chatbot released to the public late last year that can craft jokes and working computer code, guess at medical diagnoses, and create text-based Harry Potter games.

Title: The New ChatGPT, Hype vs. Reality
Author: By Brian X. Chen and Karen Hanley
Summary: Our tech columnist reviews GPT-4o, OpenAI’s latest chatbot technology, in its partly finished state.
Full Article Content: Our tech columnist reviews GPT-4o, OpenAI’s latest chatbot technology, in its partly finished state.

Title: How ChatGPT Kicked Off an A.I. Arms Race
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: Even inside the company, the chatbot’s popularity has come as something of a shock.
Full Article Content: One day in mid-November, workers at OpenAI got an unexpected assignment: Release a chatbot, fast.

Title: How Should Schools Respond to ChatGPT?
Author: By Katherine Schulten
Summary: Have you experimented with this new technology? Can teachers and students use it productively, ethically and safely in your opinion? How?
Full Article Content: Teachers: We also have a related lesson plan about teaching and learning with ChatGPT.

Title: The New ChatGPT Offers a Lesson in A.I. Hype
Author: By Brian X. Chen
Summary: OpenAI released GPT-4o, its latest chatbot technology, in a partly finished state. It has much to prove.
Full Article Content: When OpenAI unveiled the latest version of its immensely popular ChatGPT chatbot this month, it had a new voice possessing humanlike inflections and emotions. The online demonstration also featured the bot tutoring a child on solving a geometry problem.

Title: Why China Didn’t Invent ChatGPT
Author: By Li Yuan
Summary: The state’s hardening censorship and heavier hand have held back its tech industry; so has entrepreneurs’ reluctance to invest for the long term. It wasn’t always that way.
Full Article Content: Just a few years ago, China was on track to challenge United States dominance in artificial intelligence. The balance of power was tilting in China’s direction because it had abundant data, hungry entrepreneurs, skilled scientists and supportive policies. The country led the world in patent filings related to artificial intelligence.

Title: ChatGPT Transforms a Classroom and Is ‘M3GAN’ Real?
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Paula Szuchman, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop and Marion Lozano
Summary: Also, why teenagers are buying old digital cameras.
Full Article Content: A high school teacher on how the new chatbot from OpenAI is transforming her classroom — for the better. And, “M3GAN” may be closer than you think.

Title: My So-So Encounters with ChatGPT
Author: By Peter Coy
Summary: If you can’t do your job better than A.I., maybe you need another job.
Full Article Content: A mountain man buys his first chain saw. He comes back to the store a week later complaining that it cuts down only two trees a day when he was told it would cut down 20. The service person says, “Well, let’s see what the trouble is,” and starts it up. The mountain man jumps back and asks, “What’s that noise?” (He’d been sawing without the engine on.)

Title: ChatGPT Can Now Respond With Spoken Words
Author: By Cade Metz, Brian X. Chen and Karen Weise
Summary: A new version of OpenAI’s popular chatbot behaves a lot like Siri and Alexa. You can talk to it — and have a conversation.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT has learned to talk.

Title: China’s Answer to ChatGPT Gets an Artificial Debut and Disappoints
Author: By Chang Che and John Liu
Summary: The promised “live” demonstration of the bot had, in fact, been recorded. Shares of Baidu, the company behind the technology, tumbled in Hong Kong.
Full Article Content: Almost six years ago, a Google computer program toppled the best player in China — and the world — at Go, an ancient Chinese board game. The defeat catalyzed China’s revolution in artificial intelligence. Beijing unrolled a monumental A.I. plan, and investors poured record sums into new projects.

Title: OpenAI Gives ChatGPT a Better ‘Memory’
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: The A.I. start-up is releasing a new version of ChatGPT that stores what users say and applies it to future chats.
Full Article Content: OpenAI is giving ChatGPT a better memory.

Title: ChatGPT vs. Me: Who Will Write a Better Beach Read?
Author: By Curtis Sittenfeld
Summary: A fiction writer challenges an A.I. chatbot to a duel.
Full Article Content: What makes a beach read a beach read? Is it an escapist subject matter? A frothy tone? Or is any book you read on a beach automatically a beach read?

Title: OpenAI Unveils New ChatGPT That Listens, Looks and Talks
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: Chatbots, image generators and voice assistants are gradually merging into a single technology with a conversational voice.
Full Article Content: As Apple and Google transform their voice assistants into chatbots, OpenAI is transforming its chatbot into a voice assistant.

Title: Quiz: How Does ChatGPT Really Work?
Author: By The New York Times
Summary: You read Part 2 of our weeklong series on artificial intelligence. Now test your knowledge.
Full Article Content: You read Part 2 of our weeklong series on artificial intelligence. Now test your knowledge.

Title: I’m a Doctor. ChatGPT’s Bedside Manner Is Better Than Mine.
Author: By Jonathan Reisman
Summary: My job is no longer safe.
Full Article Content: As a young, idealistic medical student in the 2000s, I thought my future job as a doctor would always be safe from artificial intelligence.

Title: A New ‘M*A*S*H’ Scene: Written by ChatGPT, Read by Hawkeye and B.J.
Author: By Julia Jacobs
Summary: Alan Alda, the star of the long-running sitcom, asked the artificial intelligence software to create a script for him and his former co-star Mike Farrell to read.
Full Article Content: For the first time in more than 40 years, Alan Alda and Mike Farrell sat down for a table read of a new scene of “M*A*S*H,” stepping into their old roles of Hawkeye Pierce and B.J. Hunnicutt, two bantering doctors in a Korean War mobile surgical unit.

Title: Lesson Plan: Teaching and Learning in the Era of ChatGPT
Author: By Katherine Schulten
Summary: First students learn about and share their thoughts on the issues A.I. chatbots raise for schools. Then, we invite them to help design both ethical guidelines and curriculum projects that use the tool for learning.
Full Article Content: Featured Article: “Alarmed by A.I. Chatbots, Universities Start Revamping How They Teach” by Kalley Huang

Title: ChatGPT Made a Guest Appearance at the Marc Jacobs Three-Minute Fashion Show
Author: By Vanessa Friedman
Summary: So much to think about, so little time.
Full Article Content: When did Marc Jacobs, erstwhile downtown darling turned New York fashion éminence grise, become a philosopher of the modern condition?

Title: OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT App for the iPhone
Author: By Cade Metz
Summary: OpenAI is aiming to build on the popularity of its chatbot with a smartphone app that responds to voice prompts.
Full Article Content: Since ChatGPT debuted in November, hundreds of millions of people have experimented with the online chatbot, which can answer questions, write poetry, draft emails and riff on almost any topic from inside a web browser.

Title: How Should I Use A.I. Chatbots Like ChatGPT?
Author: By Kevin Roose
Summary: Large language models are already good at a wide variety of tasks.
Full Article Content: In today’s newsletter, the fourth in our five-part series, I’m going to try to convince you that large language models are already good at a wide variety of tasks — and they’re getting smarter every day.

Title: TikTok’s Spying Scandal and ChatGPT’s Challenge to Google
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Paula Szuchman, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Marion Lozano and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: TikTok skeptics now have a smoking gun.
Full Article Content: Calls to ban TikTok or force its sell-off from its parent company ByteDance are gaining momentum, especially after reports of ByteDance’s surveillance of several U.S. journalists. And could Microsoft’s investment in OpenAI mark the end of Google’s search monopoly?

Title: Weekly Student News Quiz: Canada, Fortnite, ChatGPT
Author: Compiled by Katherine Schulten
Summary: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.
Full Article Content: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

Title: OpenAI’s Fund-Raising Talks Could Value Company at $150 Billion
Author: By Cade Metz, Mike Isaac, Tripp Mickle and Michael J. de la Merced
Summary: The San Francisco start-up hopes to raise $6.5 billion as part of an aggressive push for more investment.
Full Article Content: OpenAI is in talks to raise about $6.5 billion as part of a deal that would value the company in the vicinity of $150 billion, a nearly $70 billion increase from its valuation nine months ago, according to five people with knowledge of the conversations.

Title: Dr. Chatbot Will See You Now
Author: By Teddy Rosenbluth
Summary: Americans are already turning to A.I. for health information in large numbers, new research suggests.
Full Article Content: Susan Sheridan had heard of ChatGPT but had never used it, so the first question she asked the artificial intelligence chatbot was a bit garbled: “Facial droop, facial pain and dental work.”

Title: Does ChatGPT Mean Robots Are Coming For the Skilled Jobs?
Author: By Paul Krugman
Summary: How A.I. will affect the demand for knowledge workers.
Full Article Content: Will robots take away our jobs?

Title: ChatGPT Is Helping Siri in iOS 18.2. And It’s Actually Useful.
Summary: If you’ve used an iPhone for any amount of time, you may have struggled with its built-in voice assistant, Siri. When Apple introduced Siri in the iPhone 4s, I excitedly tried to use the assistant to dictate and send a text message while crossing a frigid Manhattan park midwinter. But when Siri misunderstood me, I...
Full Article Content: If you’ve used an iPhone for any amount of time, you may have struggled with its built-in voice assistant, Siri. When Apple introduced Siri in the iPhone 4s, I excitedly tried to use the assistant to dictate and send a text message while crossing a frigid Manhattan park midwinter. But when Siri misunderstood me, I...

Title: ChatGPT Is Already Changing How I Do My Job
Author: By Farhad Manjoo
Summary: Journalists may have a new semi-reliable source.
Full Article Content: Once you start using ChatGPT you pretty much can’t stop. You begin with trivial, gimmicky prompts: Do this math problem. Tell me some vegetarian recipes with broccoli and peas. What came first, the jock or the jockstrap?

Title: Racing to Catch Up With ChatGPT, Google Plans Release of Its Own Chatbot
Author: By Cade Metz and Nico Grant
Summary: The internet giant said it would begin testing its new chatbot, Bard, with a small, private group before releasing it to the public in the coming weeks.
Full Article Content: Google said on Monday that it would soon release an experimental chatbot called Bard as it races to respond to ChatGPT, which has wowed millions of people since it was unveiled at the end of November.

Title: Help! My Boss Won’t Stop Using ChatGPT
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: Kevin and Casey answer your questions.
Full Article Content: This week, we answer more of your questions, like: What is ChatGPT’s carbon footprint? Why are engineers so sure artificial intelligence will keep getting better? And, why are there so many venture capital bros?

Title: Are You Using ChatGPT at Work? We Want to Hear About It.
Author: By Emma Goldberg
Summary: Just over a year since ChatGPT’s release, we’re exploring how workers have begun using A.I. chatbots in their jobs.
Full Article Content: As soon as ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence chatbots became widely available, workers began exploring how they could use the tools for their jobs — and how it might affect their jobs in the long term. Now the world has had just over a year to experiment.

Title: One Year In and ChatGPT Already Has Us Doing Its Bidding
Author: By Vauhini Vara
Summary: For me, the journey began when I asked ChatGPT who I was.
Full Article Content: One of the first things I asked ChatGPT about, early this year, was myself: “What can you tell me about the writer Vauhini Vara?” It told me I’m a journalist (true, though I’m also a fiction writer), that I was born in California (false) and that I’d won a Gerald Loeb Award and a National Magazine Award (false, false).

Title: What to Know About ChatGPT’s New Code Interpreter Feature
Author: By Yiwen Lu
Summary: Graphs, maps and data analyses? Now ChatGPT can do even more.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT, the artificial-intelligence-powered chatbot made by OpenAI, has wowed the world in recent months with the text it can generate. Now the chatbot is delighting users anew by creating charts and maps and turning images into videos.

Title: I Finally Figured Out Who ChatGPT Reminds Me Of
Author: By Elizabeth Spiers
Summary: Generative A.I. is often described as being in its infancy. The truth is a little more of a handful.
Full Article Content: As the mother of an 8-year-old, and as someone who’s spent the past year experimenting with generative A.I., I’ve thought a lot about the connection between interacting with one and with the other. I’m not alone in this. A paper published in August in the journal Nature Human Behaviour explained how, during its early stages, an artificial intelligence model will try lots of things randomly, narrowing its focus and getting more conservative in its choices as it gets more sophisticated. Kind of like what a child does. “A.I. programs do best if they start out like weird kids,” writes Alison Gopnik, a developmental psychologist.

Title: Can I Use ChatGPT for the Tedious Parts of My Job?
Author: By Kwame Anthony Appiah
Summary: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on using artificial intelligence to assist with mundane tasks at work.
Full Article Content: I’m a writer and a college professor at a small college, and I recently became chair of the English department. I usually love to write, but when it comes to administrative documents, I struggle — and this new role asks for a lot of them.

Title: Microsoft Bets Big on the Creator of ChatGPT in Race to Dominate A.I.
Author: By Cade Metz and Karen Weise
Summary: As a new chatbot wows the world with its conversational talents, a resurgent tech giant is poised to reap the benefits while doubling down on a relationship with the start-up OpenAI.
Full Article Content: When a chatbot called ChatGPT hit the internet late last year, executives at a number of Silicon Valley companies worried they were suddenly dealing with new artificial intelligence technology that could disrupt their businesses.

Title: Is A.I. Poisoning Itself?, Billionaire Cage Fight and Cooking With ChatGPT
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Marion Lozano, Sophia Lanman and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: The missing ingredient in A.I. content might soon be human-generated content.
Full Article Content: Whether it’s on TikTok or Twitter, A.I.-generated content is already flooding the web. So, what happens when the technology — prone to confidently making things up — starts ingesting itself?

Title: A Trip to TikTok, ChatGPT’s Origin Story and Kevin Systrom’s Comeback
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Paula Szuchman, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Marion Lozano, Sophia Lanman and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: Casey becomes a content moderator, Kevin breaks some news on OpenAI and Instagram’s co-founder reveals his new project.
Full Article Content: TikTok is opening up a “Transparency and Accountability Center” to try to win over skeptics. Is the company’s strategy working? Then, the origin story of OpenAI’s ChatGPT and how the company kicked off an A.I. arms race.

Title: How Strangers Got My Email Address From ChatGPT’s Model
Author: By Jeremy White
Summary: Researchers at Indiana University used ChatGPT’s model to extract contact information for more than 30 New York Times employees.
Full Article Content: Researchers at Indiana University used ChatGPT’s model to extract contact information for more than 30 New York Times employees.

Title: Quiz: How Should I Use A.I. Chatbots Like ChatGPT?
Author: By The New York Times
Summary: You read Part 4 of our weeklong series on artificial intelligence. Now test your knowledge.
Full Article Content: You read Part 4 of our weeklong series on artificial intelligence. Now test your knowledge.

Title: Can ChatGPT Plan Your Vacation? Here’s What to Know About A.I. and Travel.
Author: By Julie Weed
Summary: Powerful new artificial-intelligence software is already shaking up the travel industry, but it has a long way to go until it can plan a seamless trip. For now.
Full Article Content: One day soon, in the artificial-intelligence-powered future, a vacation might start by telling your smartphone something like this: “I want to take a four-day trip to Los Angeles in June, whenever airfares and hotel rates are best, using loyalty rewards points. I want to hit a history museum and an amusement park — and then I’d like 7 p.m. dinner reservations near the hotel at a restaurant with vegan options and a great wine list.” And your phone spits out the perfect itinerary.

Title: Google C.E.O. Sundar Pichai on Bard, A.I. ‘Whiplash’ and Competing With ChatGPT
Author: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano and Rowan Niemisto
Summary: “Am I concerned? Yes. Am I optimistic and excited about all the potential of this technology? Incredibly.”
Full Article Content: For years, Google was seen as one of the most cutting-edge developers of A.I. But, with OpenAI’s release of ChatGPT, and other chatbots beating Google to market, is that distinction still the case? Google’s chief executive is in an unenviable position: Scramble to catch up or, in the face of potentially harmful technology, move slowly.

Title: All Seal Needs Is Love
Author: By Jeremy Gordon
Summary: Embarking on a tour celebrating his music career’s 30th anniversary, the singer and songwriter explained how tennis, Joni Mitchell and ChatGPT have inspired him.
Full Article Content: The singer and songwriter Seal is one of modern music’s most ardent believers in the power of love, but that doesn’t mean you should look to him for romantic advice. “You’re headed for disaster if you ask me,” he joked, before immediately providing what sounded like a practical perspective on how to make a relationship work. “I’ve found that it’s most productive when both parties see themselves, and then there’s this third entity which is like a plant. That plant needs water every day, and you love that plant because you — both as an entity, and as individuals — are all that it has.”

Title: Should Students Let ChatGPT Help Them Write Their College Essays?
Author: By Katherine Schulten
Summary: If so, how? Tell us what you are thinking, and what practical and ethical questions these new A.I. tools raise for you.
Full Article Content: Teachers: We also have a lesson plan that accompanies this Student Opinion forum.

Title: Kara Walker: A Fortuneteller in the Land of ChatGPT
Author: By Karen Rosenberg
Summary: The artist’s dystopian installation at SFMOMA shows her evolution as a public artist. In her carnival sideshow she casts a wary eye on tech’s future.
Full Article Content: In artworks exploring unequal power dynamics across a wide swath of history, Kara Walker has long called attention to the most inhuman tendencies of people. Now, in a new installation in the country’s tech capital, she is highlighting the superhuman capabilities of A.I. as only she can.

Title: Are You Using ChatGPT in Your School or University? We Want to Hear About It.
Author: By Natasha Singer
Summary: We’re asking educators and students how they are using new A.I. chatbots for teaching and coursework.
Full Article Content: New chatbots powered by artificial intelligence upended public schools and universities across the United States last winter. Some colleges and districts raced to block student access to the A.I. tools over fears they could enable widespread cheating.

Title: ChatGPT Can Now Generate Images, Too
Author: By Cade Metz and Tiffany Hsu
Summary: OpenAI released a new version of its DALL-E image generator to a small group of testers and incorporated the technology into its popular ChatGPT chatbot.
Full Article Content: ChatGPT can now generate images — and they are shockingly detailed.

Title: How to Use ChatGPT and Still Be a Good Person
Author: By Brian X. Chen
Summary: It’s a turning point for artificial intelligence, and we need to take advantage of these tools without causing harm to ourselves or others.
Full Article Content: The past few weeks have felt like a honeymoon phase for our relationship with tools powered by artificial intelligence.
